snippet.title:
"Evening Dress of Queen Elizabeth"
This dress was designed by Norman Hartnell for Queen Elizabeth, the wife of George VI. Norman Hartnell designed gowns for Elizabeth Bowes-Lyon from 1935 until his death. In 1937, after he came to the throne, George VI wanted more regal dresses for his wife and so requested that a number of dresses be made for her by Hartnell. This dress in particular dates from 1953 and follows the look that many of her dresses took from the 1930’s onwards, with a bell shaped crinoline.
#Dress #QueenElizabeth #1900s #ElizabethBowesLyon #NormanHartnell #RoyalFamily #GeorgeVI ﻿

Queen Elizabeth II Planet Earth Wish You Happy 88 Birthday Be in Peace and Love Forever Earth Whispers For Queen Heart
If I could give you a gift It would be peace. Peace of mind Peace of Heart
Peace of mind would be for you to know that someone loves you. Peace of Heart would be for you to know that you are free to go.
The one who loves you wants you to be free. No expectations where none were given. Just let yourself know that it's okay, And it's a compliment to your kindness to have touched This Heart in a way so special, That peace of mind and Heart Is the only gift I wish for you.
If I could catch a rainbow I would do it just for you, And share with you its beauty On the days you're feeling blue
If I could build a mountain You could call your very own, A place to find serenity, A place to be alone
If I could take your troubles I would toss them in the sea, But all these things I'm finding Are impossible for me
I cannot build a mountain, Or catch a rainbow fair, But let me be what I know best, A friend who's always there Bajic Zivko Belov

Engineers Develop Mobile App to Find Their Way Around Elizabeth Class Ships. BAE Systems integration manager Steve Brown said: “Getting lost on the ship was an everyday occurrence. Programmers came up with a navigation system for the ship, which is more than 306 yards long and has 3000 compartments across 12 decks. HMS QUEEN ELIZABETH, is now structurally complete at 56 metres tall – which is higher than the Niagara Falls – while her length of 280 metres is greater than three football pitches. Platform Navigation is expected to become an invaluable part of engineers’ toolkits.﻿
